intro: Crotalaria descampsii, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and distinctive leaf structure, with trifoliate leaves that have a velvety texture. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules. Crotalaria descampsii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
